revised_title: On the Polarization of Light by Crystallized Surfaces
tldr: David Brewster's experiments reveal that the action of crystallized surfaces on light is not independent of the position of the crystal's principal section. He demonstrates that the force of double refraction and polarization emanates from the surface of bodies, and the intensity depends on the inclination of the surface to the crystal's axis. Brewster also shows that the ordinary or extraordinary image can be extinguished in a doubly-refracting crystal, converting it into a singly-refracting crystal.
